How many D2 molecules per In were dosed in the highest loading experiment for MFM-300(In) according to the neutron powder diffraction data?
What is the main interaction observed between adsorbed CH4 molecules and the pore of MFM-300(In)?
Is the rotation of adsorbed CH4 molecules within MFM-300(In) free or hindered according to the inelastic neutron scattering experiments?
data.answer: The rotation of adsorbed CH4 molecules is almost free.

data.question: True or False: The adsorption of CH4 in MFM-300(In) at 35 bar and 298 K is one of the highest values reported for a MOF.
True or False: The density of adsorbed CH4 in MFM-300(In) at 110 K and 0.6 bar is lower than that of liquid CH4.
What method was used to calculate the isosteric heat of adsorption for CH4 in MFM-300(In)?
What force field was used to describe the CH4 molecule in the Grand Canonical Monte Carlo simulations for MFM-300(In)?
True or False: The INS spectra for MFM-300(In) show significant changes in vibrational peaks upon CH4 adsorption.
What is the estimated isosteric heat of adsorption for H2 in MFM-300(In) according to the Virial fitting?
True or False: The adsorption of D2 in MFM-300(In) results in the formation of a 'solid-hydrogen-like' material within the pores at high loadings.
What is the role of phenyl rings in the adsorption of CH4 within MFM-300(In)?
data.answer: Providing space confinement for the adsorbed CH4 molecules.

data.question: True or False: The binding interaction between adsorbed CH4 molecules and the hydroxyl groups within MFM-300(In) is weaker than in CH4/water clathrates.
What is the main difference in the binding interaction of CH4 in MFM-300(In) compared to CH4/water clathrates?
data.answer: In MFM-300(In), CH4 binds along the H–O bond, whereas in clathrates, the dominating interaction is H3C–Hguest···Ohost–H.

data.question: True or False: The INS spectra for MFM-300(In) loaded with H2 show a new peak at 9.5 meV, indicating rotational motion of adsorbed H2.
What is the effect of increasing H2 loading on the INS spectra of MFM-300(In)?
data.answer: There is an increase in the area of peaks related to rotational and recoil motion of adsorbed H2.

data.question: True or False: The rotational barrier for CH4 molecules adsorbed on the most stable site in MFM-300(In) is high, indicating restricted rotation.
What is the significance of including Site VII in the model for MFM-300(In) loaded with 6.08 D2 per In?
data.answer: It demonstrates the importance of including the additional binding site for accurate refinement.
